content.description: Uncertain - PM me if I am wrong.  Very easy beginning leads to good vertical slot, good horizontal crimp, and bad sloper.  Moving up to bad feet will get you to the jug.
content.location: Right before Mark's Lunge

content.description: Sit start with right hand on an obvious square side pull with a good right catch. Left hand on mediocre low hold. Pull the bulge and the moves ease off.

Uncertain if existing - PM me if I am wrong. Links the start of "The Politician" into "The Racist". Starting holds for The Politician, climb up to the left sloping edge and make a far move left out to the series of side pulls that comprise The Racist. Finish and top out are the same as The Racist.
content.location: On the Heinousness Wall, linking The Racist and The Politician.

content.description: Sit start. Another hard move off the deck yields more positive climbing. Better feet than Coincidence to its left.
content.location: Left side of the Glass Onion Sector to the left of Coincidence.

content.description: Crimp up the vertical face to a mono-crimp and crank to the top. Topout.
content.location: Just to the right of Kundilini

content.description: Uncertain - PM me if I am wrong.  Side pulls and good feet.
content.location: Right after Mark's lunge.

content.description: After initial moves to left handed slopey layback maneuver to more slopey right hand. Press and squeeze to good foot. Don't miss the gaston before the lip.
content.location: Just past the racist.  Last problem before wall becomes heavily featured.

content.description:
Start on the obvious positive hold (same start as Kundilini) and move up through a crimp and a good hold on the left side of the arete. Set your feet and dyno to the jug horn on top. Traverse out right and top out through the same finish as RU Sirius.

 Same problem as Kundilini except you skip the slots and go straight up.
content.location: Towards the beginning of Heinousness Wall. Same start as Kundilini immediately to the right of the rock shelf.

content.description: Clean line up good crimps that are well spaced.  Lunge/dyno to the lip for a nice topout.  The high foot variation to not lunge is called static cling.
content.location: Just right of catcher in the Rye.

content.description: Juggy Pockets.Decent Warmup.
content.location: Immediately to the right of the stone steps.

content.description: Two hand start using the undercling and the crimp to the left of the undercling near the bottom of the boulder. Nice move with the right hand to a slopey edge. Cam your heel into the bottom of the dihedral to make a move into the left crimp. Use your body tension, possibly with a toe hook, to land the pocket.  After the pocket it's smooth sailing. Move to a gross pinch for an easy top out sequence.
content.location: On the very end of Heinousness Wall on the overhanging section. Has a large shelf a few feet above the start.

content.description: A balancy diagonal climb with high feet and fun presses. Highball top out. Reaching the broken layer off rocks is the top. Recommended down climb.
content.location: Look for a stair step of 90 degree ledges moving right to left.

content.description: Follow the fun and easy flake to the top.  Jump down, climb down, or topout and walk through the parking lot.
content.location: The large flake just right of kundilini/religion.

content.description:
From a sit start below and just left of the arete on Kundilini, climb straight up using a series of crimps on the left side of the arete to a deadpoint to the first hold left of the arete on Kundilini and then dyno to the horn above as per Kundilini Rising and top out into the parking lot through the choss. The arete and holds right of the arete are off, as well as the rock bench to the left.

 A worthy eliminate if you're looking for a new challenge.
content.protection: Two+ pads. Landing is flat and grassy, but the problem is moderately tall.
content.location: Climbs just left of the arete feature on Kundilini from a sit start.

content.description: Begin on positive hold, move up to sloper and then to the left side of arete to good crimp. Match and make big move to good slot. Continue to topout.
content.location: Begins just to the right of an obvious arete on heinousness wall.

content.description: Climb to the right of the bowl of vegetation. A little reachy for kids
content.location: Mossy Route

content.description: Start matched on an undercut/side pull. Move up and right through slopey pockets and right hand undercut. Then a big move to a juggy shelf up right. *Avoiding the hand holds to the left of the start hold.Note: Starting on the sloper pockets is "Jo Kool" - V2
content.location: If you're facing the Heinousness Wall this is to the right of the stone stairs and to the right of the first dihedral/bulge.

content.description: Climb the politician but eliminate the gaston before the lip.
Low start. A sharp but good right hand pocket and a small left hand enable you to pull hard and get off the deck. Make a few burly moves to get your feet up and then cruise to the top.
content.location: On the right side of the glass onion, look for a pocket about waist high. Put your right hand in it. If it feels a bit sharp, you've found it.

content.description: Great first climb for kiddos!
content.location: Look for a mossy easy climb

content.description: Traverse down the easier area of Heinousness wall
content.protection: Pads that a friend can follow you with
content.location: Start on the arête to the right of the main routes at Heinousness wall (past Johnny’s Lunge) and traverse right to the down climb area.

content.description: Sit start. A good left hand side pull and a mediocre right hand pocket leave you with a variety of pockets to progress up to two good jugs. From there, a pocket and a side pull will get you to the top.
A hard and long move off a low start leads to an easy (and possibly dirty) finish.
content.location: This is at the left side of the Glass Onion area. Walk past the main Heinousness wall with Kundalini, R U Sirius, and the Politician and then continue past the traverse wall.

content.description: I remember 1 great crimp, 1 2-finger crimp, and several side pulls.  You might find something else. Jump down, climb down, or top out into the parking lot.
content.location: Just to the right of RUsirius. Look for big sloper sidepulls.

content.description: Limestone wall. Vertical/Slabby
